subject: Re: [junit] Anyone help me to figure out the java.lang.StackOverflowError problem?
msgSnippet: Hi Fuguo, I am not sure what is going wrong with your program. But here is some advice which will hopefully help you in resolving it: 1. Try writing some test
messageBody:
Hi Fuguo,
I am not sure what is going wrong with your program. But here is some advice
which will hopefully help you in resolving it:
1. Try writing some test cases for the other methods you have written. If
these test cases also result in the stack overflow, then they will hopefully
narrow down what circumstances the problem occurs under.
2. Look for places in your code where something is being added to a
collection. These are places where not implementing a hashCode or equals
method; or the order of inserts might be important. Write test cases to
validate that these are working as you expect.
3. Refactor the very long methods into smaller methods while adding tests
for them. It is hard to understand and debug methods that have deeply nested
if/else conditions.
4. You can try adding System.out.println's to your code as Stefan suggests.
I would do this as a last resort. The failing test case is trying to tell
you something about the code and the process used to write it.
5. When you find the fix, report back and let others know about the
experience. It's always good to share :-)
Good luck!
-Dennis

On Thu, Aug 7, 2008 at 8:07 AM, Stefan Schulze <algroth@...> wrote:

> Hi Fuguo,
>
> I didn't meant that you have the same problem. I just wanted to say that it
> could be one of these bugs which only disclose under strange circumstances.
> It doesn't neccessarily is caused by JUnit just because it only occures if
> executed as JUnit-test.
>
> I figured it out by adding some System.out.println's and analyzing the
> output. I noticed that it fails if the output shows a particular order of
> iteration.
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com> [mailto:
> junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com>] On Behalf Of
> Fuguo Wei
> Sent: Thursday, August 07, 2008 11:35 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> Subject: RE: [junit] Anyone help me to figure out the
> java.lang.StackOverflowError problem?
>
> Dear Stefan Schulze,
>
> there is no Hashset in my code. How could you figure out it is the Hashset
> problem. May be you give the way to discover it and I will try to turn it
> out following your way.
>
> Regards
> WEI FUGUO
>
>
>
